| HistoryText             = 
===Origin===
With an increasing number in the student body, [[Scott Summers (Earth-616)|Cyclops]] and [[Emma Frost (Earth-616)|Emma Frost]] reorganized the [[Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters|Xavier Institute]]'s educational and training program.{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 #1}} The New Mutants Squad was advised by [[Danielle Moonstar (Earth-616)|Dani Moonstar]].{{r|New Mutants Vol 2 #1|#13}}{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 #2}}{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe A to Z Vol 1 13}}

===Academy X===
Even before their official formation, New Mutants Squad and the [[Hellions Squad (Earth-616)|Hellions Squad]] were at odds with each other.{{r|New Mutants Vol 2 #1|#13}} The two squads became intensely competitive during Field Day events.{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 #1|#4}} This rivalry came to a head when [[Kevin Ford (Earth-616)|Wither]] was arrested by the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation (Earth-616)|FBI]]. The Hellions went to take on the F.B.I. and free Wither, and the New Mutants went to stop them from fighting the government. The [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]] intervened before any damage was done, but Wither and [[Joshua Guthrie (Earth-616)|Icarus]] switched teams because of the event.{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 #5|#6}}

Together the New Mutants discovered the ghost of [[Jeffrey Garrett (Earth-616)|Jeffrey Garrett]] was still inhabiting the [[Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters|X-Mansion]].{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 #7|#9}}

Wither continued to clash with [[Joshua Foley (Earth-616)|Elixir]] (primarily over [[Laurie Collins (Earth-616)|Laurie]]'s affections). During the semester, Wither discovered Elixir had had a brief affair with a professor, [[Rahne Sinclair (Earth-616)|Wolfsbane]]. He informed the entire school, successfully ending Josh's relationship with Laurie and terminating Wolfsbane's employment.{{r|New Mutants Vol 2 #12}}

==Members==
* [[Joshua Foley (Earth-616)|Elixir]] - Josh Foley can manipulate individuals' biologies by touch to heal or harm. Retained his powers and remained with the X-Men until leaving for personal reasons.{{r|X-Force Vol 3 #25}}
* [[Joshua Guthrie (Earth-616)|Icarus]] - Jay Guthrie possessed red angel-like wings mounted on his back, had an accelerated healing process, and possessed voice mimicry. Retained his powers, but was later killed by [[William Stryker (Earth-616)|William Stryker]].{{r|X-Force Vol 3 #27}}
* [[Prodigy (David Alleyne)|Prodigy]] - David Alleyne could temporarily gain skills and knowledge of those near him. Co-Field Leader. Depowered, but remained with the X-Men.
* [[Noriko Ashida (Earth-616)|Surge]] - Noriko Ashida is a young Japanese girl who absorbs electricity which she can release as blasts, or use for super-speed, but requires [[Power Gauntlets|mechanical gauntlets]] to prevent overcharge. Retained her powers and remained with the X-Men.
* [[Laurie Collins (Earth-616)|Wallflower]] - Laurie Collins was a shy girl who generated pheromones to influence others' emotions. Retained her powers, but was later killed by [[Matthew Risman (Earth-616)|Matthew Risman]].{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 #25}}
* [[Sofia Mantega (Earth-616)|Wind Dancer]] - Sofia Mantega could manipulate wind. Co-Field Leader. Depowered, briefly joined the [[New Warriors (Earth-616)|New Warriors]].{{r|New Warriors Vol 4 #1}}

==M-Day==
After [[Decimation|M-Day]] only 27 of 182 enrolled Xavier's students retained their powers. The New Mutants Squad was disbanded along with all the other [[X-Men Training Squads]]. Several of squad members, who retained their powers, were inducted into the [[New X-Men (Earth-616)|New X-Men]].{{r|New X-Men Vol 2 #20|#23}}

| Trivia                  = * The squad’s colors were yellow and white with grey accents.
* The squad was named after the original [[New Mutants (Earth-616)|New Mutants]] to which their adviser, [[Danielle Moonstar (Earth-616)|Dani Moonstar]], belonged.
